intro: Chaetogastra tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, four-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments.
